articles.question: Two balls are drawn in succession and without replacement, from a jar containing eight red balls and four white balls. What is the probability that the first ball was white given that the second ball was red? Use Bayes' theorem
articles.answer:
Lets let:
$W_1$ represent the probability that the first ball drawn is white
$R_1$ represent the probability that the first ball drawn is Blue
$W_2$ represent the probability that the Second ball drawn is White
$R_2$ represent the probability that the Second ball drawn is Blue
We will start off by finding the probability that the second ball drawn is red
$$P(R_2)=(R_2\cap W_1)+(R_2\cap R_1)$$ $$P(R_2\cap W_1)= rac{4}{12} imes rac{8}{11}$$ $$P(R_2\cap W_1)= rac{8}{33}$$ $$P(R_2\cap R_1)= rac{8}{12} imes rac{7}{11}$$ $$P(R_2\cap R_1)= rac{14}{33}$$ $$P(R_2)=(R_2\cap W_1)+(R_2\cap R_1)$$ $$P(R_2)= rac{8}{33} + rac{14}{33}$$ $$P(R_2)= rac{22}{33}$$ Now we want to apply the conditional probabilty function:
$$P(W_1|R_2)= rac{P(W_1\cap R_2)}{P(R_2)}$$ $$P(W_1|R_2)= rac{ rac{8}{33}}{ rac{22}{33}}$$ $$P(W_1|R_2)= rac{8}{22}$$ $$P(W_1|R_2)= rac{4}{11}$$ Therefore the probability that the first ball was white given that the second ball was red is $P(W_1|R_2)= rac{4}{11}$
